name: Eskdale Lodge Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very friendly and nice staff, nice restaurant and bar, delicious and cheap food, fantastic and clean rooms, beautiful backyard garden, quiet environment, good location (near metrolink)
reviews.title: comfortable and warm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very Clean, very friendly place in a great location. We will never stay in a travel Inn in Manchester again.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife on a recent visit to watch Manchester United. The hotel was a 10 minute walf from the tram station which took us straight into Old Trafford. We stayed in room 1 which is a LARGE double room on the first floor. The room was faultless, with a 32 inch plasma on the wall which my wife could watch Eastenders on whilst I was at the football. The food was excellent and we only paid £10 for 2 fish chips and peas BARGIN. The bar has a very friendly relaxed atmosphere to it, with many "locals" frequenting it.Garvan is an avid Manchester United fan, what he doesn't know about United isn't woth noing, and was extremely helpfull in getting me to the ground.
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.text: The breakfast really is a full breakfast! It kept us going all day.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: Chose it off the Internet. All rooms en-suite. Lovely and clean. Nice and warm ( it was very cold outside)! Friendly staff. Breakfast both days was excellent even managing to cook 2 perfect soft boiled eggs
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel- clean warm, comfortable, friendly staff & free WiFi

reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive at first as I usually stay in the "proper hotels" but decided to stay at a B&B this time for something different and had a fantastic stay. The hosts were lovely and very obliging, the rooms were fine and the food was delicious!! Felt like I was at home. Definitely would recommend.
reviews.title: little gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I mentioned, the only thing which might be useful is a instruction sheet on using the shower.....figured it out but I had never seen one before!! :)
reviews.title: Friendly staff and great food, all at a great price

reviews.text: We chose to stay here on a trip to see Manchester United play. In comparison to the overpriced hotels near the ground, I'm confident this was a better bet. The decor in this hotel is a little outdated and the shower dribbled rather than gushed, but at such a reasonable price and with such nice staff I'd happily stay there again. Also, the food was fantastic!
reviews.title: Welcoming, Comfortable, Enjoyable

reviews.text: We stayed as a party of 5 in 3 rooms, all the rooms were comfortable, spacious and had good facilities. Staff were welcoming and flexible to our needs. Rooms had widescreen TVs in them. Room was quiet and dark at night. We enjoyed the food, we had a evening meal when we got there late in the evening, and really enjoyed it. Breakfast was very good also.
reviews.title: A really comfortable and welcoming place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel because of it's location and it was perfect for us. Given the price we thought it was great value and found the staff friendly and the room clean and comfortable. We also enjoyed the continental breakfast both mornings, there was a small additional charge but that wasn't a problem. The free parking and wifi were also appreciated.
reviews.title: Clean, comfy and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did notice some noise from the bar area downstairs when they set up for breakfast but I didn't notice it at night though. It was not a major issue.
reviews.title: Meeting Friends at a half way point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent Service, very good room,food choice and presentation first class.
reviews.title: Good value and an eye for detail

reviews.text: A good position for the trams into manchester and easy access to the motorways
reviews.title: Home from Home
Clean, comfortable, quiet hotel, Great hosts and staff.
reviews.text: We liked the atmosphere and will use again

aka: Eskdale Lodge Hotel Sale, Greater Manchester
description: The Eskdale Lodge is a small family run hotel set in a residential area in Sale. We have 9 letting bedrooms all of which have an en-suite, television (including sky), and a welcome tray including tea and coffee making facilities, and complimentary biscuits and mints. The hotel has two bars, and a restaurant. We at the Eskdale take care in providing comfortable accommodation in a relaxed and informal atmosphere.
